com.testlims.zeroMQcore

Class HTTPnoMQServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • com.testlims.zeroMQcore.HTTPnoMQServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    @WebServlet(description="HTTP Servlet without zeroMQ",
            urlPatterns="/no0mq")
public class HTTPnoMQServlet
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    HTTPzeroMQServlet handles HTTP POST requests, and sends them to zeroMQ request (REQ) socket. The servlet runs the following step:
    1. Assigns the requestId each request, and adds it to the request JSON object.
    2. Logs the request Id and service being requested.
    3. Send out the request to the zeroMQ broker.
    4. Logs the request Id and returning response from the zeroMQ broker.
    In order to run the servlet both the MessageLogger and the Request/Response zeroMQ modes need to be running.
    Author:
    Marc Whitlow, Colabrativ, Inc.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
